meanings.definition: Make or become slack or less taut.
meanings.sent1: When you release the tension, the rope slackens.
meanings.sent2: She slackens the grip on the fabric to let it hang loosely.
meanings.sent3: The cat playfully slackens its hold on the toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: As the day progresses, the wind slackens its force on the sails.
meanings.sent5: The heat of the sun slackens the adhesive, causing the sticker to peel off easily.

meanings.sent1: To make the knot easier to untie, you slackens it a bit.
meanings.sent2: He slackens the belt after a big meal to feel more comfortable.
meanings.sent3: The tailor slackens the waistband to ensure a better fit.
meanings.sent4: The grip on the jar slackens as it is twisted open.
meanings.sent5: The tension in the muscles slackens after a relaxing massage.

meanings.sent1: As the storm passes, the rain slackens to a drizzle.
meanings.sent2: The music gradually slackens, signaling the end of the performance.
meanings.sent3: Her interest in the game slackens as she gets tired.
meanings.sent4: The conversation slackens as people start to leave the room.
meanings.sent5: The excitement in the crowd slackens as the game reaches its conclusion.
